body_html:
setup.py will only install Pytorch by default. Part of Pytorch is Aten, which is included in libcaffe2. If the root level CMakeLists.txt is called only to build Aten for Pytorch then BUILD_CAFFE2 will be 0 to avoid building the rest of Caffe2. If you want to also build Caffe2 then use "FULL_CAFFE2=1 python setup.py install" instead.

setuptools does not support propogating flags that well, so if you want to build with different packages then is the default then you have to call cmake-make yourself, i.e. these instructions https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=ubuntu&configuration=compile

If you want to also build Caffe2 then use "FULL_CAFFE2=1 python setup.py install" instead.
setuptools does not support propogating flags that well, so if you want to build with different packages then is the default then you have to call cmake-make yourself, i.e. these instructions https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=ubuntu&configuration=compile
body:
setup.py will only install Pytorch by default. Part of Pytorch is Aten, which is included in libcaffe2. If the root level CMakeLists.txt is called only to build Aten for Pytorch then BUILD_CAFFE2 will be 0 to avoid building the rest of Caffe2. If you want to also build Caffe2 then use "FULL_CAFFE2=1 python setup.py install" instead.

setuptools does not support propogating flags that well, so if you want to build with different packages then is the default then you have to call cmake-make yourself, i.e. these instructions https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=ubuntu&configuration=compile
